CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 26, 1960, pg. 1, reads: "Face Bricks and Firebrands - One-year-old Tyrone Jones (with dish in hand), his face still scarred with cuts from flying glass when a bigot hurled a brick through the kitchen window of a house at 3135 W. Carson St. on Nov. 8, is shown with his older sisters who, together with about 34 other persons, including more than 20 children, constantly face flying bricks and secretly placed firebrands by which a bigoted individual hopes to drive Negroes from a previously all-white neighborhood. Ella Jones, older sister of Tyrone and daughter of Mrs. Ceola Jones, displays bricks tossed through their kitchen window. - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Baby Tyrone Jones seated with dish and brick, and two other children of Ceola Jones, posed in kitchen with broken window, 3135 West Carson Street
